Description of incident: An agency laptop and 50 pages of medical information were stolen from an employee's car on April 6. A database with information from the Oklahoma Birth Defects Registry was on the laptop.  Data from hospital medical records were recorded on the laptop.  The Oklahoma Birth Defects Registry uses the information to track and reduce the prevalence of birth defects.  Notifications of the breach state that parent and child names, Social Security numbers, addresses, birth dates, medical records and medical test results may have been exposed. Notifications also warn that any phone calls or mail sent to home addresses that request Social Security numbers should be thoroughly investigated.
